intro: Diplotaxis tenuisiliqua var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to arid conditions. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
